title: Can you shoot a coyote on your property in Texas? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, if you are not in an incorporated area. If you are out in the country, let ’er rip, tater chip, and so long Wiley. Most Texas towns and cities frown on gun fire within their city limits. But there are allowable instances even then. See the “Castle Doctrine” for instance. And the weapon you use must be one that you are legally allowed to possess. Happy hunting.

Howdy, Coyotes are classified as predators…so yes. Interestingly pigs are destructive to crops and livestock and yet Game Wardens can fine you for shooting them. You now need a Hunting License in Texas to hunt rabbits.
Yes. But not within the city limits of Houston, Dallas, Plano, Fort Worth, El Paso…. You surely are getting the gist of things by now.
